reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from one week at the Barbados where we got off to a bad start over incorrect room allocation- no sea view. I was made to feel that I was after something for nothing and the poor staff attitude went right through the holiday. The entertainment is kiddie based and therefor we went out of the hotel.
reviews.title: Big Disapointment

reviews.text: The hotel is in no way 4 star and the food is very ordinary and really underfunded.The restuarant is like a railwat station buffet and rush rush rush you could not relax and eat.
reviews.title: Great for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great and so is Magalluf, we will go again but not to Sol anywhere
reviews.title: OK for a cheap deal
Above average
reviews.text: Have just got back from our stay at the Sol Barbados. We went with our 2 children aged 4 and 2 and we all had a fantastic holiday. Hotel is out of the way with regards to what people expect Magalluf to be like, we didn't see any crowds of young people but bear in mind we were probably back at out hotel by 11pm, the night was only just starting for the young ones! However, the hotel was just down some steps to the beach one said and to the main road the other side.

Our room was a family room on the first floor, which was great as it meant we could walk up the stairs rather than be waiting around for the lift. We had tgwin beds and a set of bunkbeds, however, there wasn't any railing on the top bunk so we weren't happy for our 4 year old to sleep in it. Decor in room was dated and I wouldn't have rated it 4*. Good things - fridge in room, laundry service if required (which we did use although a bit pricey!), towel service, loads of entertainment day and night.
reviews.title: A 1970s hotel going through refurbishment - disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having spent the last 11 years visiting the resort,I was surprised that my wife wanted to go there for our honeymoon,and was determined to book her a hotel with a bit more class than the norm. The Antillas did not disappoint. Spectacular views from our balcony on the 10th floor, the best equipped and cleanest room I have ever seen in Mallorca, a double bed that would have slept 6 comfortably - And complimentary champagne from the management on our first night! We were informed that the hotel had been refitted during the winter, and it definitely showed.Even the food was plentiful and first class - I actually ate in the hotel on a couple of occasions, which is unheard of for me.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel for our honeymoon

likes.disliked: — shower could have been more powerful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were also excellent, even the chamber maids gave us a cheery 'ola' in the mornings.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel so much!
Pleasant but not exciting
reviews.text: Will definitely book again (probably for a wedding anniversary)

When I was looking for a hotel to stay at while we were in Magalluf I wanted something in the quiet area as we deal with clublife in the UK nearly everyday of the week. So when I found this hotel is the was the other end to all of the nightlife. We decided not to book anything until we got to Magalluf as being it was October we knew that we could get a hotel out there what ever happened. When we got to the hotel after a very busy flight and no leg room I just wanted to unpack and go and get a drink. We went to book a room at the hotel and the gentleman in reception told us it would be cheaper for us to book through their website and gave us a free access ticket to use their computers. We saved nearly £200 pounds. We really liked a room as it was over looking the beach and where our balcony was you just walked down straight onto the beach it was great. The only thing that we were not to happy was that the food seemed to be a little cold even though we were normally quite early for dinner. But it is definately worth going to stay at the Antillas not the Barbados hotel though
reviews.title: Most Beautiful View Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Moved here from Sol Guadalupe because it is supposed to be a better hotel. Overall quality is better than Sol Guadalupe. The two hotels are within walking distance.
reviews.title: The Sea View was fabulous

likes.liked: — Almost on the beach, great air conditioning,fast lifts, yummy desserts!
likes.disliked: — Lots of steps, not good for elderly people

reviews.text: We stayed 8 nights in Sol Antillas and it was rather pleasant experience. The hotel is in Magaluff, which is famous by noisy entertainment for tourists, but the location is such that it is quiet during the night and you can get a good night rest. Reception service was professional and efficient. Rooms are spacious, clean and well equiped. Bathroom is fabulous. Beds are a bit on the smallish side, but OK. Balconies are perfect, ours with a sea view, which was fabulous. Food was excellent, wide variety of dishes, everything was tasty. Service during dinner time can be problematic due to huge number of guests and only a few of waiters. Pool area looks nice, although I do not use pool when on the seaside. It seems that hotel has excellent entertainment for kids. I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: My review is of the Sol Antillas as i have not stayed in its sister Barbados hotel. The hotel improves year on year and for me is the best hotel in Magaluf. The dining choice is excellent as are all the services which includes a spa. The entertainment was great and included an amazing adults only night, a step up for Sol hotels. All the staff are friendly including the maids who all say Hola whenever they see a guest. The great thing about the hotel is that despite its location in this lively resort you get no rowdiness within the hotel but still a vibrant atmosphere.
reviews.title: brilliant hotel

reviews.text: We ended up here as the Sol Guadalupe messed up our booking and didn't have the rooms. There were 7 of us of varying ages for my hen do. Although the woman on reception was very rude we did not have to wait too long to get our rooms, the rooms are okay in size but not massive there were 3 of us in one room and we had to keep chasing them to get the 3rd bed in there.
reviews.title: Don't listen to the others!

reviews.text: I was going to book this hotel originally but was put off by the other reviews but don't be put off this is a nice hotel. Also someone mentions there are not alot of English in this hotel, they speak excellent English but welcome you trying your Spanish.
reviews.title: o.k

reviews.text: Hotel is clean but the public toilet areas a little grubby at times but that is the fault of the people using them.
reviews.title: Run-down, noisy, 1 1/2 stars, maybe

reviews.text: Having been recommended to me, my wife and i decided to go for our holidays there, and how i wish i hadnt, it was a terrible experience, i know that the first 2 weeks in October is nearing the end of season but that is no excuse, the room was in a nice state when we arrived but then the list of faults started, the veranda door didnt lock (reported 3x still waiting), air conditioning broke down twice, the shower didnt work unless you let gallons of water come out the tap straight down the drain, ........
reviews.title: Hotel from hell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then there was the canteen (restaurant my ----). same food every day apart from the one where there was a curried pork dish but that was just the pork stew with curry powder added. then they shut the restaurant of the Barbados down and everyone had to go to the antillas, meaning you had to queue to get in, queue to get fruit juice, queue to get a fried egg, queue for use of the toaster breakfast seemed to take forever.
reviews.title: Fab location

likes.liked: — the room and the view from balcony
likes.disliked: — some staff were not too friendly

reviews.text: Night time was just as bad for queueing but then you had the wine waiter, 3x we were overcharged for the wine, intentionally in my opinion, when they realised you checked the bill the overcharging soon stopped ..........well it did till you got to the bar, every time the waiter served us he short changed us, ussually by 5 euros, once again i thought intentional, sometimes you even had to ask for your change as they werent to keen on giving you any.
reviews.title: Sandra, Moscow

likes.liked: — Close beach, lots of discos in 15min walk distance, delicious food, cleanness everywhere

reviews.text: Then at night there were the kids, most were well behaved, but you could watch the parents going out and leaving their kids at the hotel to run wild, there is more but i would be typing all night, in my opinion stay clear of this one, i have been in Magaluff/Palma Nova quite a few times and this place is by far the worst of them all.
reviews.title: Not what I expected from the Sol Hotel Group

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks Aug/Sep 2005. After seeing mixed reviews we were a bit nervous about our stay but someone on tripadvisor suggested emailing the hotel and asking for a room on floors -1 or -2. We sent an email requesting a refurbished room and were on the floor below restaurant(-1 I think). Room was really nice, it was cleaned every day with fresh towels,bedding seemed to be changed every 2 or 3 days. View from bulcany was lovely. Staff were ok but not the friendliest we've come across apart from our waiter in the evening who was very friendly and quick to bring our drinks. the hotel has a really good beach location and is at the far end of Magalluf so all the bars are easy to get to but not right on your doorstep.
reviews.title: 4 stars but with some bad aspects
